references.reason: This paper introduces the Turing Test, a foundational concept in AI that the current paper draws inspiration from and builds upon for its own proposed self-awareness test.
This paper provides a philosophical foundation for the concept of self-awareness, which is crucial to understanding the nature of the proposed test and its application to AI systems.

This survey paper provides a comprehensive overview of the philosophical literature on self-consciousness, which helps frame the discussion and provides relevant background information for the proposed test.
This influential work offers insights into the complexities of selfhood and consciousness which informs the conception of the nested doll model of self-awareness.

references.paper_title: Specifying the self for cognitive neuroscience
references.reason: This paper offers a neuroscientific perspective on self-awareness, complementing philosophical and psychological viewpoints, aiding in creating a more robust framework for understanding and testing self-awareness in machines.
